image.altText: Australians are due to receive a tax cut from July.

props.synopsis: Which neighbourhoods, occupations and age groups are more likely to benefit or miss out from the redesign of the stage 3 tax cuts? We've delved into the data to find out how different parts of Australia compare.

title.children: Nurse, teacher, surgeon — is your job likely to win from the revised tax cuts?

image.altText: A man in a dark suit with a red tie sits in a darkened room.

props.synopsis: Since becoming WA premier last year, Roger Cook has made youth justice a key part of his leadership, telling ABC state political reporter Keane Bourke the issue is too important to politicise.

title.children: Roger Cook's stance on youth justice is markedly different from Mark McGowan's — he says it's about doing 'what's right'

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses walks surrounded by people.

props.synopsis: The operator of a jumping castle that killed six children after being lifted into the air pleads not guilty to a related safety charge in a northern Tasmanian court.

title.children: Profanity hurled at Hillcrest jumping castle operator after she pleads not guilty

image.altText: A wanted posted in Japan

props.synopsis: It's relatively easy to disappear in Japan — so much so, there's even a name for the thousands of people who deliberately go missing each year: the Johatsu. The country's most wanted terrorist may have been one of them.

title.children: Japan's most-wanted man had a perfect cover to elude capture. But when he was drunk, he gave away a clue

image.altText: A court sketch shows a bald man with a large beard.

props.synopsis: A former CIA software engineer was sentenced to 40 years in prison for what the US government described as the biggest theft of classified information in CIA history and for possession of child sexual abuse images and videos.

title.children: Ex-CIA engineer sentenced for leaking hacking secrets to WikiLeaks

image.altText: A graphic showing a group of school children and federal education minister Jason Clare

props.synopsis: There was a major development around funding for public schools this week. Let us break it down for you.

title.children: There was a 'landmark' moment for public school funding this week. Here's what's going on

image.altText: Two men, one armed with a gun, stand among a crowd of people at a funeral.

props.synopsis: Fears of regional escalation are growing as the Israel-Gaza war drags on, with data showing political violence has increased across the Middle East. These are the four main hotspots.

title.children: How the Iran-backed Axis of Resistance is changing the stakes of the Israel-Gaza war

image.altText: A woman puts a cashless debit card in a brown wallet

props.synopsis: They have pledged to bring back a version of the controversial scheme if they win the next federal election, suggesting there have been "devastating consequences" since it was scrapped.

title.children: Federal Liberals back cashless debit card reintroduction in response to crime, social issues

image.altText: Photos of a dozen fossiled footprints in brown sandy, rock

props.synopsis: Scientists believe footprints that were accidentally found on a Moroccan beach were made by five modern humans 90,000 years ago.

title.children: Scientists race against tides to discover why 90,000-year-old footprints were made

image.altText: Lewis Hamiton, sitting down, holding a towel to his face, looks upward with a red light shining on him, at night after a race

props.synopsis: F1's statistically greatest driver is joining F1's most successful team, a gamble both are taking to secure the world championship they desperately want, writes Michael Doyle.

title.children: Lewis Hamilton gambles everything on red to become F1's greatest champion

image.altText: An aerial shot of two crews hosing down a muddy tennis court.

props.synopsis: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Kirrily is continuing to dump heavy rain on north-west Queensland, while the chance of another tropical cyclone forming off the coast increases.

title.children: 'Anything is possible': Ex-cyclone continues dumping rain on Queensland as threat of new low looms

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: The legal battle between ousted Liberal MP Moira Deeming and Victorian Opposition Leader John Pesutto will proceed to a 10-day Federal Court trial, with the pair represented by two of the nation's leading defamation barristers.

title.children: Pesutto and Deeming 'well armed' with top lawyers for Federal Court showdown

image.altText: The embassy of the People's Republic of China was opened in 1990. Yarralumla, Canberra, 2017.

props.synopsis: A Chinese embassy official confronts Australia's new cyber ambassador after he told a gathering of diplomats in Canberra that Beijing was responsible for a series of devastating online attacks against this country.

title.children: Chinese embassy confronts Australian official who accused Beijing of cyber attacks

image.altText: A road sign on the side reading Djiagween Road

props.synopsis: WA Police say they were called to Broome Hospital around 3am on Thursday after a 41-year-old woman presented with serious injuries.

title.children: Woman flown to Perth with serious injuries after being struck by vehicle in Broome

image.altText: Cahills Crossing viewing platform

props.synopsis: A dry season phenomenon draws both locals and tourists to the notorious Cahills Crossing in the Northern Territory. But a ranger says some people are ignoring warnings about the risk of crocodile attacks.

title.children: Humans and crocodiles don't get any closer than at this notorious outback crossing

image.altText: A security camera still of a man with an injury to his eye carrying a bottle of water

props.synopsis: Police are searching for a man who threw an alkaline substance at a woman and her two young daughters in London, with two of the victims suffering potentially life-changing injuries in the attack.

title.children: London police hunt man who threw 'corrosive substance' at a woman and her daughters

image.altText: housing estate shot from a drone

props.synopsis:
Will Australia be able to build enough homes to meet demand? It's becoming less likely with new data showing lending for new homes is slowing following 13 rate rises since May 2022. 

Stocks rise as Apple, Amazon and Facebook's Meta post results and a major wine company has had to recapitalise. Follow live.

title.children: Share market rises, DP World dispute ends, experts worry Australia won't build enough homes to meet demand

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Will Australia be able to build enough homes to meet demand?
DP World and Maritime Union end industrial action

image.altText: Numbered lottery balls mid-air.

props.synopsis: Two Australians have struck gold, winning $100 million each in Powerball's largest ever jackpot in history.

title.children: Two Powerball winners share record $200 million lottery haul

image.altText: Donald Glover and Maya Erskine sitting on a park bench smiling, one holding a drink, both in character as Mr & Mrs Smith

props.synopsis: The original Mr & Mrs Smith starring Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt led to some legendary popular culture moments. Now, a TV series starring Donald Glover and Maya Erskine provides a new take on the 2005 film. And they couldn't be more different.

title.children: New Mr & Mrs Smith TV series creates another deadly combination

image.altText: Composite image of Joni Mitchell playing the guitar and Tracy Chapman, presenting an award.

props.synopsis: From Taylor Swift to Tripod, here are all the nominees and performers to look out for at the Grammys this year.

title.children: The Grammys will feature rare performances from Joni Mitchell and Tracy Chapman. Here's how to watch

image.altText: Workers at sewing machines

props.synopsis: Big clothing brands have been criticised over conditions in their suppliers' Myanmar factories, but now that some are pulling out of the country entirely, advocates warn workers will be left even worse off.

title.children: Workers turn to sex work as big clothing brands pull out of Myanmar

image.altText: A train going past a train station in Sydney's north.

props.synopsis: Police said the man in his 20s and woman in her 30s died after being hit by the train at Berowra Railway Station about midnight.

title.children: Two people die after being hit by freight train in Sydney

image.altText: An array of clear dropped bottles of different colours, on cream surface,  taken from above

props.synopsis: We look at the evidence behind some of the most common ingredients found in skincare products that claim to reduce the appearance of wrinkles and dark spots.

title.children: Skincare products promise to slow the effects of ageing, but how well do they really work?

image.altText: Peter Dutton at a press conference at EastCoast Beverages at Kulnura on NSW Central Coast.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton has given his strongest suggestion the Coalition will vote alongside the government to pass revised tax cuts to benefit lower and middle income workers — but he has left a final decision for when parliament sits next week.

title.children: Dutton dodges decision on tax cuts, but says he won't 'take money' from middle Australia

image.altText: Police tape with lights in the background.

props.synopsis: Police say one of the girls seriously injured in the Garbutt crash could be left permanently disfigured.

title.children: Five teenagers in hospital after stolen car crashes into tree in Townsville

image.altText: A large crowd gathered outside the Opera House

props.synopsis: NSW Police say forensic analysis finds no evidence the phrase "gas the Jews" was chanted in videos circulating online from a pro-Palestinian rally in October, despite people providing statements the phrase was used.

title.children: Video analysis finds no evidence 'gas the Jews' chant used at Opera House rally, police say

image.altText: two men on stage, one playing a guitar and the other singing

props.synopsis: Aleksandr Uman's anti-war posturing drew the ire of the Kremlin, and now, he and his bandmates have found safety in Israel after an international saga that raised questions about Russia's influence abroad.

title.children: Aussie rocker avoids deportation to Russia, ends up in Israel after diplomatic stoush

image.altText: An image composite of three young people, they all smile into the camera.

props.synopsis: Coming out can be a nerve-racking experience, but Adam, Eliott and Rowen did it and managed to find connection and community along the way.

title.children: Coming out as trans can be tough in regional Australia. Here's how these three teens did it

image.altText: A fence in front of a white wall with Sara Lee written on a red background.

props.synopsis: The dessert manufacturer sold this week, but the company will not repay a "shocking amount of money" to its creditors.

title.children: Almost $10m of Sara Lee debt to creditors won't be paid, hurting small providers

image.altText: A close up of Anthony Albanese in a suit and tie, wearing glasses

props.synopsis: Those wanting comprehensive tax reform aren't saying trust should be breached — they're arguing now's the time to put the tax system on the table for review, writes Michelle Grattan.

title.children: Albanese has started a cat-and-mouse battle on tax — and a scare campaign will follow

image.altText: An older woman with white hair sits on a couch. A temperature gauge in the foreground read 30 degrees Celsius.

props.synopsis: Sixty-eight-year-old Suellyn Lott's Sunshine Coast apartment complex was officially opened less than 12 months ago, but she says living there is unbearable when the temperature spikes.

title.children: Woman, 68, living in new social housing forced to take showers and hide in car to cool down during heatwave

image.altText: A Palestinian man stands near a burnt out car near Salfit in the West Bank

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden imposes sanctions on four Israeli men accused of being involved in settler violence in the West Bank, signalling growing US displeasure with the policies of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title.children: US imposes sanctions on Israeli settlers accused of West Bank violence

image.altText: A white middle-aged man sits on a chair in his art studio

props.synopsis: The acclaimed British artist trades tennis balls and tattoos while unveiling his signature work at the National Gallery of Victoria.

title.children: David Shrigley doesn't approve of your tattoo, but he'll still draw it on
